metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3611 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A stack overflow vulnerability was found in the Intel HD Audio device (intel-hda) of QEMU. A malicious guest could use this flaw to crash the QEMU process on the host, resulting in a denial of service condition. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability. This flaw affects QEMU versions prior to 7.0.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3611` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> introduced in 5.0.0-rc0 by: https://git.qemu.org/?p=qemu.git;a=commit;h=a9d8ba2be58e067bdfbff830eb9ff438d8db7f10  Part of the DMA reentrancy issues. Fixing this requires backporting the 22 DMA changes listed below.

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.36').
